tool_description: Welcome to SendGrid’s Web API v3! This API is RESTful, fully featured, and easy to integrate with.
name: SendGrid
title: SendGrid

api_list.name: Send
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to send email over SendGrid’s v3 Web API,
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/send"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/send"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

Please send an email to jane.smith@company.com saying 'Your order has been shipped' with the subject 'Order Update'.
I need to send an email to support@service.com with the subject 'Account Issue' and the body 'I am unable to log in to my account.'
Send an email to marketing@business.org with the subject 'Newsletter April' and content 'Check out our latest offers and updates.'
Could you send an email to hr@company.com with the subject 'Job Application' and the message 'Please find my resume attached.'?
Send an email to feedback@website.net with the subject 'Website Feedback' and the message 'I love the new design, great job!'
Please send an email to info@conference.com with the subject 'Registration Confirmation' and the body 'Thank you for registering for the event.'
I want to send an email to billing@serviceprovider.com with the subject 'Invoice Request' and the message 'Could you please send me the latest invoice?'
Send an email to admin@school.edu with the subject 'Parent Meeting' and the message 'The parent-teacher meeting is scheduled for next Friday.'
Can you send an email to sales@retailstore.com with the subject 'Discount Inquiry' and the message 'Are there any discounts available this month?'

api_list.name: Create a batch ID
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to generate a new batch ID. This batch ID can be associated with scheduled sends via the mail/send endpoint.  If you set the SMTPAPI header batch_id, it allows you to then associate multiple scheduled mail/send requests together with the same ID. Then at anytime up to 10 minutes before the schedule date, you can cancel all of the mail/send requests that have this batch ID by calling the Cancel Scheduled Send endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/batch"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

        }

print(response.json())

utterances.utterance: Can you generate a new batch ID for grouping my scheduled email campaigns?
I need a batch ID to link multiple scheduled sends together, could you create one for me?
Please provide a fresh batch ID so I can associate it with my upcoming scheduled emails.
Could you create a batch ID that I can use to manage several scheduled mail sends at once?
I want to generate a new batch ID to organize my scheduled email deliveries, can you help?
Generate a batch ID for me to group multiple scheduled email requests under one identifier.
Please create a batch ID so I can cancel all related scheduled emails if needed.
I’d like a new batch ID to associate with my scheduled mail sends for easier management.
Can you provide a batch ID that will let me link and control multiple scheduled email sends?
I need a batch ID to batch together several scheduled emails, could you generate one now?

api_list.name: Cancel or pause a scheduled send
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to cancel or pause an email that has been scheduled to be sent.  If the maximum number of cancellations/pauses are added, HTTP 400 will be returned.  The Cancel Scheduled Sends feature allows the customer to cancel a scheduled send based on a Batch ID included in the SMTPAPI header. Scheduled sends cancelled less than 10 minutes before the scheduled time are not guaranteed to be cancelled.  For more information on Scheduled Sends, visit https://sendgrid.com/docs/Classroom/Send/When_Emails_Are_Sent/can_i_stop_a_scheduled_send.html
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/scheduled_sends"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

Please cancel the upcoming scheduled email before it goes out.

Is it possible to halt the email delivery I arranged for tomorrow morning?

I need to stop the email that’s queued for sending soon.
Please put a hold on the email scheduled for dispatch later.
Can the email I planned to send be canceled before it goes out?

api_list.name: Create a new suppression group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new suppression group.  Suppression groups, or unsubscribe groups, are specific types or categories of email that you would like your recipients to be able to unsubscribe from. For example: Daily Newsletters, Invoices, System Alerts.  The name and description of the unsubscribe group will be visible by recipients when they are managing their subscriptions.  Each user can create up to 25 different suppression groups.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/asm/groups"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

utterances.utterance: Can you set up a new suppression group called 'Weekly Updates' for managing subscription preferences?
I want to create a suppression group named 'Promotional Offers' so users can opt out of marketing emails.
Please add a new unsubscribe category titled 'Event Notifications' for recipients to manage their email preferences.
Could you establish a suppression group called 'Billing Alerts' to help users unsubscribe from invoice emails?
Set up a new suppression group named 'Product Announcements' so subscribers can control those emails.
I need a suppression group labeled 'Customer Surveys' to allow recipients to opt out of feedback requests.
Create a new unsubscribe group called 'Security Updates' for users to manage security-related email subscriptions.

Can you make a new suppression group titled 'Service Alerts' to help users unsubscribe from system notifications?
I want to create a suppression group called 'Special Promotions' to let users opt out of promotional emails.

api_list.name: Add suppressions to a suppression group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to add email addresses to an unsubscribe group.  If you attempt to add suppressions to a group that has been deleted or does not exist, the suppressions will be added to the global suppressions list.  Suppressions are recipient email addresses that are added to unsubscribe groups. Once a recipient's address is on the suppressions list for an unsubscribe group, they will not receive any emails that are tagged with that unsubscribe group.

utterances.utterance: Please add john.doe@example.com to the newsletter unsubscribe group.
Can you suppress jane.smith@company.org from the promotions mailing list?
Add michael.brown@domain.net to the event updates unsubscribe group.

Please add robert.wilson@webmail.com to the weekly digest suppression list.
Could you suppress laura.martin@companymail.com from the customer feedback emails?
Add david.lee@techcorp.io to the beta testers unsubscribe group.
Please unsubscribe sarah.kim@marketinghub.com from the monthly offers group.
I want to add chris.evans@newsletters.org to the daily news suppression list.
Can you add natalie.green@updates.net to the special promotions unsubscribe group?

api_list.name: Search for suppressions within a group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to search a suppression group for multiple suppressions.  When given a list of email addresses and a group ID, this endpoint will return only the email addresses that have been unsubscribed from the given group.  Suppressions are a list of email addresses that will not receive content sent under a given group.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the suppression group that you would like to search.

utterances.utterance: Can you check which emails are unsubscribed from the newsletter group with ID Marketing_2024?
I want to find out the suppressed contacts in the event_updates group.
Please show me the list of emails that have opted out from the promotions group ID Promo_Offers.
Could you retrieve the unsubscribed addresses from the customer_feedback suppression group?
Get me the suppressed email addresses for the group named Weekly_Newsletter.
I need to see which users have unsubscribed from the product_alerts group.
Find all suppressed emails under the group ID User_Engagement.
List the email addresses that are blocked in the group called Holiday_Sales.
Show me the suppression list for the group ID Tech_Updates.
Can you provide the emails that have unsubscribed from the group named Monthly_Reports?

api_list.name: Create a parse setting
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new inbound parse setting.  The inbound parse webhook allows you to have incoming emails parsed, extracting some or all of the content, and then have that content POSTed by SendGrid to a URL of your choosing.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/webhooks/parse/settings"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

utterances.utterance: Can you set up a new inbound parse webhook to handle incoming emails and forward their content to my server?
I want to create a parse setting that processes emails and sends the extracted data to my application endpoint.
Please configure a new inbound parse setting to capture email content and post it to my specified URL.
Help me establish a webhook that parses incoming emails and forwards the parsed content to my backend service.
I need to create a new inbound parse configuration to extract email data and send it to my API endpoint.
Set up an inbound parse setting that will parse emails and post the extracted information to my web server.
Could you create a new inbound parse webhook that processes incoming emails and forwards the content to my URL?
I want to add a parse setting to handle incoming emails and send the parsed content to my application URL.
Please create a new inbound parse webhook that extracts email content and posts it to my specified endpoint.
Can you help me create a parse setting that will parse incoming emails and forward the data to my server URL?
